DataElement.preferredName: Submitted Tumor Tissue Prior Biopsy Or Resection Performed Year Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value that represents the year that the biopsy or surgical resection prior to the operation that yielded the submitted sample was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Submitted Tumor Tissue Prior Biopsy Or Resection Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something._A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination._Earlier in time or order._Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.:A tissue sample, or entire tumor that is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: The act of referring for judgment or consideration by others; the act of handing over something.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Removal and pathologic examination of specimens in the form of small pieces of tissue from the living body.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ. :Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for LGG per request by T.Lichtenberg. mc 8/19/13

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Event; something that happens at a given place and time._The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Event; something that happens at a given place and time.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: Something that happens at a given place and time.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
